are very much separate processes and the history of this comes from uh Chrome itself because it's got uh browsers
which run their own separate tabs in their own processes this means that the browser tab when it crashes it cannot
bring down the whole process that sort of architecture has come over into electron and uh it's just something to keep in mind in general when you are
going forward for most of your stuff um that's UI it'll be in the renderer but for most of the things that need to
touch the operating system you'll do that stuff in the main thread and you'll use IPC to communicate back and forth uh

about OS conventions so Mac and windows are very much different operating systems they have a rich history of doing things differently and as as
you're building out your electron apps you should be mindful of this stuff uh from um the actual UI side example uh
Mac OS has very sorts of expectations around the top menu it expects the first item to be the
app's name um it has certain naming conventions for menu items it also does Capital case every item every word in a
menu item should be uh uppercased not uppercased um should start with a capital letter the window side has its
own thoughts file becomes the first item uh menu item names are a bit more relaxed uh menu item names are sentent
cased as well the very first character is uppercase everything else generally says lowercase unless like for proper
names and things like that these things matter because users notice them and users they'll stand out so uh
ensure that you are familiar with the stuff that you are deploying to and making sure that the stuff fits in um because yes users will raise bugs
probably my favorite bug that came up when we were testing this internally was from a Mac User there was a concept
called destructive Windows um sorry destructive dialogues and these are supposed to behave differently unlike on
Windows where the primary menu button there should be emphasized they wanted the other one to be uh um emphasized so
that by default you would like not go and make destructive changes so we need to handle this stuff at runtime for
certain menu items that we knew that was destructive again this was raised by Mac User we could have probably got in out the door without it happening but these
things are noticeable and the and people do care about this stuff so the debugging side that someone
